title.narrative: 4.1. PUBLIC MANAGEMENT CAPACITIES

description.narrative: By 2021, public officials and authorities at the national level and in the priority territories will have strengthened their capacities to manage policies and allocate and deliver budgets to eliminate gaps in exercising the rights of adolescents and children., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Economic And Social Policy General, Human Rights Institutions, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, adolescents and children will continue to be recognized by society and the Peruvian State as subjects of law and will be prioritized in social regulations, policies and budgets.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, public officials and authorities at the national level and in the priority territories will have strengthened theircapacities to manage policies and allocate and deliver budgets to eliminate gaps in exercising the rights of adolescents andchildren.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical assistance and generated evidence to develop 14 national and sub-national policies, plans and projects on children and adolescents.; 437 public officers and civil society members capacities were strengthened, and budget programmes at the national and local were improved. UNICEF continued supporting the approval process of the National Policy for Development and Social and provided technical assistance to develop an innovative National Care System National Programme on Care. The National Multisectoral Policy for Children and Adolescents 2022-2030 developed with UNICEF support was finally approved. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2021

baseline.value: Huancavelica: 952 millions soles; Loreto: 1,406 millions soles; Lima: 7,628 millions soles; Ucayali: 643 millions soles

target.value: 2021:Huancavelica: is increased by at least 3%; Loreto: is increased by at least 8%; Lima: is increased by at least 6%; Ucayali: is increased by at least 18%

actual.value: 2021:Huancavelica: 1,266 million (+10.7%) Lima: 9,826 million (+14.5%) Loreto: 2,053 million (+14.1%) Ucayali: 898 million (0%)
